thought: The gmail send action (action_1) needs properly set params with keys: 'to', 'subject', 'text' (or 'html') to send email successfully. Currently, params is empty dict {}, causing execution error. The input_data already contains the required fields inside 'json', so I will map these fields into params accordingly.
plan: Rewrite action_1 to extract 'sendTo', 'subject', 'emailType', 'message' from input_data json and set them as params for gmail send action.
Test action_1 alone with sample input_data to verify email sending works.
Then test mainWorkflow again with the fixed action_1.
Fix any further issues if needed.
criticism: Current action_1 does not set required params for gmail send action, causing workflow failure with execution error.
